first_reasoning: Investing the full $10 million in the Industrial Products Division offers the best chance to reverse our earnings slide within the next fiscal year. That division already maintains stable sales growth, has shorter product development cycles, and fielded direct customer requests for performance enhancements. By focusing R&D there, we can deliver prototypes in six to nine months, secure early trials with top accounts, and begin generating incremental revenue before year-end, ensuring a measurable return on our investment.
second_reasoning: Allocating 16 million to Industrial R&D targets the division with proven customer demand and predictable development cycles, maximizing our chance of reversing losses within the next 12–18 months. Reserving 4 million for a focused Consumer “moonshot” maintains upside potential for a breakthrough product without diluting our push for near-term earnings relief.
